text.#text: Nothing in this Act or

In order for an investigational drug or device to be intended for use in accordance with this
			 subsection, such drug or device must be intended for use by a patient who
			 has—
been diagnosed with a terminal illness by a licensed physician;

been informed by a licensed physician that no drug or device that is lawfully marketed in the
			 United States is likely to cure the illness; and
executed a written informed consent document that states—
the known and potential risks and benefits of such drug or device; and

any indications of the illness for which a drug or device is lawfully marketed, or for which
			 treatment is otherwise available, in the United States.
